body:
Hello guys! I was considering donating for the gold package but I was concerned about purchasing it with the EULA changes. 

Owen states that : "Ranks are allowed so long as any perks gained are cosmetic. Coloured names, prefixes, special hats etc. are fine."

And according to the donation packages the only "Non-Cosmetic" items on the packages are the kits. I was curious if the staff at Avicus were going to change these to something else? Or maybe make it so they are unlockable ingame or something similar to that. Because Owen also states that :

"If the “kits” contain gameplay-affecting features they are not allowed. Gameplay balance is not relevant to the EULA. If the items included in the kit are purely cosmetic, you can charge real money/hard currency."

I was just curious, that way I know what changes are going to be made, that way I know what I am donating for! Thanks so much guys!

replies.body:
How should servers deal with users who have already spent hard currency on features that affect gameplay?

Users may keep the perks they’ve paid for on the condition that the same perks are available to other players on the server (directly or purchasable using soft currency). It’s up to the server host to decide how to compensate users for previous transactions.

Just found that here: https://mojang.com/2014/06/lets-talk-server-monetisation-the-follow-up-qa/

Maybe Avicus could use some sort of soft currency available through game wins and stuff so that non-ranked players can still purchase these things and people who have already paid for it, can keep their perks.
